intro: Angelica pseudoselinum, commonly known as lesser angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical characteristics of Angelica pseudoselinum make it a valuable species for both ecological and medicinal studies.
